description: The Ateneo de Manila University, founded by Spanish Jesuits in 1859, is one of the Philippines' leading universities. The John Gokongwei School of Management (JGSOM) is the undergraduate business school committed to developing ethical business leaders grounded in Ignatian values of service and excellence.

Boston College's Carroll School of Management, established in 1938, is a Jesuit business school that integrates ethics, social responsibility, and global perspectives into its curriculum. Named for Wallace E. Carroll, it emphasizes developing business leaders who make a difference in the world.

ICADE (Instituto Católico de Administración y Dirección de Empresas) is the business school of Universidad Pontificia Comillas in Madrid. Founded in 1892 by the Society of Jesus, it is one of Spain's most prestigious business schools, combining academic excellence with Jesuit humanistic values.

Creighton University's Heider College of Business, named in 2013 after benefactors Charles and Mary Heider, carries on the Jesuit tradition since the university's founding in 1878. The school focuses on developing ethical business leaders through its values-based education approach.

businessSchool: Charles F. Dolan School of Business
description: The Charles F. Dolan School of Business at Fairfield University is a Jesuit business school in Connecticut that combines rigorous academics with experiential learning. The school emphasizes ethics, innovation, and service, preparing students to be responsible business leaders.

The Gabelli School of Business, established in 1920, is Fordham University's business school with campuses in the Bronx and Manhattan. As a Jesuit institution, it integrates ethical business practices and social responsibility into its curriculum, producing leaders for the global marketplace.

Fu Jen Catholic University was founded in Beijing in 1925 and re-established in Taiwan in 1961. The College of Management is one of Taiwan's leading business schools, combining Catholic values with modern business education and strong international partnerships.

Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business was founded in 1957 and is located in the heart of Washington, D.C. As the nation's oldest Catholic and Jesuit university's business school, it emphasizes global perspectives, principled leadership, and ethical decision-making.

Gonzaga University's School of Business Administration was established in 1921, building on the university's founding by Jesuits in 1887. The school integrates Jesuit values of service, ethics, and care for the whole person into its business education programs.

IQS School of Management, part of Ramon Llull University, was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1905. Located in Barcelona, it combines over a century of Jesuit educational tradition with innovative business education, preparing students for global business challenges.

ITESO, the Jesuit University of Guadalajara, was founded in 1957 and is the largest private university in western Mexico. Its School of Business focuses on developing socially responsible business leaders who contribute to sustainable development and social justice.

John Carroll University's Boler College of Business carries forward the Jesuit tradition since the university's founding in 1886 as St. Ignatius College. The school emphasizes ethical leadership, critical thinking, and service to others in its business programs.

Le Moyne College was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1946, and the Madden School of Business was named in 2012. The school integrates Jesuit values of intellectual rigor, ethical responsibility, and service into its business education programs.

Loyola Marymount University's College of Business Administration combines Jesuit and Marymount traditions since 1865. Located in Los Angeles, the school emphasizes ethical business practices, entrepreneurship, and social responsibility in preparing future business leaders.

The Quinlan School of Business was founded in 1922 and was a pioneer in Jesuit business education. Located in downtown Chicago, it emphasizes ethical leadership, responsible business practices, and developing leaders who create sustainable value.

businessSchool: Sellinger School of Business and Management
description: The Sellinger School of Business and Management at Loyola University Maryland was formally established in 1980, though business courses began in 1937. Named for Father Joseph Sellinger, S.J., the school integrates Jesuit values into contemporary business education.

businessSchool: Joseph A. Butt, S.J. College of Business
description: The Joseph A. Butt, S.J. College of Business at Loyola University New Orleans became a full college in 1947. The school combines Jesuit values with business education, emphasizing ethics, social responsibility, and preparing students for the global business environment.

Marquette University's College of Business Administration was founded in 1910 as the School of Economics and became a college in 1923. The school integrates Jesuit values of service, ethics, and excellence in developing business leaders who make a difference.

The National College of Ireland was founded in 1951 as a joint venture between the Jesuits and Irish trade unions. Originally called the Catholic Workers College, it has evolved into a leading business school in Dublin's International Financial Services Centre.

businessSchool: Faculty of Economic and Administrative Sciences
description: Pontificia Universidad Javeriana's Cali campus opened in 1970, extending the Jesuit educational tradition from Bogota. The Faculty of Economic and Administrative Sciences offers programs in business, economics, and accounting with a focus on social responsibility and ethics.

businessSchool: Anderson College of Business and Computing
description: Regis University was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1877. The Anderson College of Business and Computing, renamed in 2018, integrates Jesuit values with business and technology education, preparing students for ethical leadership in a rapidly changing world.

Rockhurst University, founded in 1910, is Kansas City's Jesuit university. The Helzberg School of Management emphasizes ethical leadership, experiential learning, and values-based education in preparing students for careers in business and management.

Saint Joseph University of Beirut was founded by French Jesuit missionaries in 1875. The Faculty of Business and Management (Faculté de Gestion et de Management) is one of the university's 13 faculties, offering business education with a focus on ethics and leadership.

businessSchool: Erivan K. Haub School of Business
description: The Erivan K. Haub School of Business at Saint Joseph's University was founded in 1927 and named in 1988. Located in Philadelphia, it emphasizes Jesuit values of ethics, service, and developing leaders who create positive change in business and society.

businessSchool: Richard A. Chaifetz School of Business
description: The Chaifetz School of Business was founded in 1910, making it the oldest business school west of the Mississippi River. As part of Saint Louis University's Jesuit mission, it emphasizes ethical leadership, global perspectives, and service to others.

businessSchool: Frank J. Guarini School of Business
description: Saint Peter's University was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1872. The Frank J. Guarini School of Business, named in 2019, continues the Jesuit tradition of preparing ethical business leaders who serve the community and contribute to the common good.

The Leavey School of Business was founded in 1923 at Santa Clara University, California's oldest operating institution of higher learning. Located in Silicon Valley, it integrates Jesuit values with innovation, ethics, and entrepreneurship education.

businessSchool: Arthur J. Kania School of Management
description: The University of Scranton was founded in 1888. The Kania School of Management, named for a distinguished alumnus, emphasizes Jesuit values of ethics, service, and care for the whole person in developing business leaders for a complex global environment.

businessSchool: Albers School of Business and Economics
description: The Albers School of Business and Economics at Seattle University was founded in 1945. The school integrates Jesuit values with business education, emphasizing ethics, sustainability, and developing leaders who serve the common good.

Sogang University was founded by the Wisconsin Province of the Society of Jesus in 1960. The Sogang Business School, accredited by AACSB in 2009, ranks among Korea's top business schools, combining Jesuit values with rigorous business education.

university: UNISINOS - Universidade do Vale do Rio dos Sinos
description: UNISINOS was founded in 1969 by the Society of Jesus in southern Brazil. The School of Business is one of six schools at the university, offering programs that integrate Jesuit values with contemporary business education and social responsibility.

The College of Business Administration at the University of Detroit Mercy dates back to 1916. The university was formed in 1990 through the merger of Jesuit and Mercy institutions, combining traditions of service, ethics, and academic excellence.

businessSchool: Faculty of Economics, Social Sciences and Business Administration
description: The University of Namur was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1831. The Faculty of Economics, Social Sciences and Business Administration offers programs that combine rigorous academic training with the Jesuit commitment to social responsibility.

The University of San Francisco was founded by the Jesuits in 1855. The School of Management emphasizes ethical leadership, social responsibility, and developing business leaders who make a positive impact on the world.

Universidad Católica del Uruguay was founded in 1882 and became a university in 1985. The UCU Business School, AACSB accredited since 2021, is the only school in Uruguay with this certification, combining Catholic values with excellence in business education.

Deusto Business School was founded in 1916 as Spain's first business school. Part of the University of Deusto, founded by the Society of Jesus in 1886, it combines academic excellence with Jesuit values of ethics, social responsibility, and service.

Universidad del Pacífico was founded in 1962 with support from the Society of Jesus by business leaders seeking to develop ethical business professionals. Pacífico Business School is Peru's leading business school, emphasizing ethics, leadership, and social responsibility.

businessSchool: Faculty of Economics and Business Sciences
description: Universidad Loyola Andalucía was founded in 2011 by the Spanish Province of the Society of Jesus. The Faculty of Economics and Business Sciences offers programs emphasizing ethical business practices, social responsibility, and Ignatian values.

Xavier Institute of Social Service was established in 1955 by the Society of Jesus as an extension of St. Xavier's College, Ranchi. XISS offers management programs focusing on rural development, human resources, and social responsibility.

Xavier University was founded in 1831, and the Williams College of Business was established in 1961. The school integrates Jesuit values of ethics, service, and developing the whole person with rigorous business education.

Xavier Institute of Management Bhubaneswar (XIMB) was established in 1987 by the Society of Jesus. Part of XIM University since 2021, XIMB is one of India's premier business schools, combining Jesuit values with management excellence.

XLRI was founded in 1949 by Fr. Quinn Enright, S.J., making it India's oldest business school. Run by the Society of Jesus, XLRI is known for its excellence in human resource management and its commitment to developing ethical business leaders.

businessSchool: Richard J. Wehle School of Business
description: Canisius University was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1870 in Buffalo, NY. The Richard J. Wehle School of Business offers programs that integrate Jesuit values of ethics, service, and intellectual excellence into business education.

Ateneo de Davao University is run by the Philippine Jesuit Province. The School of Business and Governance was launched in 2000, offering programs in accountancy, business management, and entrepreneurship grounded in Ignatian values.

Universidad Iberoamericana Puebla was founded in 1983 by the Society of Jesus. The school offers business and economics programs that integrate Jesuit values of social responsibility, ethics, and service to the community.

Australian Catholic University's Peter Faber Business School, named after the Jesuit saint, offers programs that integrate Catholic intellectual tradition with contemporary business education. The school emphasizes ethical leadership and social responsibility.

businessSchool: Faculty of Economic and Administrative Sciences
description: Pontificia Universidad Javeriana was founded in 1623 and is one of Colombia's oldest and most prestigious universities. The Faculty of Economic and Administrative Sciences offers programs emphasizing ethics, social responsibility, and Jesuit values.

Universidad Iberoamericana was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1943. Located in Mexico City's Santa Fe district, the Department of Business Administration offers programs that integrate Jesuit values with contemporary business education.

ESADE was founded in 1958 and has been part of Ramon Llull University since 1995. As one of Europe's leading business schools, ESADE integrates Jesuit educational principles with innovative business education and global perspectives.

The University of San Diego's Knauss School of Business was founded in 1972 with the belief that global partnerships are key to business success. The Catholic university emphasizes ethical leadership, social innovation, and sustainability.

Universidad Católica de Córdoba was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1956. ICDA (Instituto de Ciencias de la Administración) has been offering business programs since 1967, combining Jesuit values with executive education and leadership development.

Sanata Dharma University was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1955 in Yogyakarta, Indonesia. The Faculty of Economics offers programs in accounting, management, and economics, integrating Jesuit values of service and social responsibility.

Universidad Alberto Hurtado was established in 1997 through the merger of Jesuit institutions in Chile. The Faculty of Economics and Business, founded in 1998, offers programs emphasizing social responsibility, ethics, and sustainable development.
